content.description: The fingery route up the middle of the steep wall. Sustained 5.11 climbing off the deck brings you to a one move crux (easier if you're tall) three bolts up. Easier edging brings you to the anchors.
content.protection: 8 bolts to chains.

content.description: Victoria's Secret is a worthwhile TR problem to try after climbing the Panty Prow.  Climb straight up the wall below Panty Prow's anchors to the top.
content.protection: Toprope route only.  TR after climbing Panty Prow (5.6).

content.description: All the holds are obvious, due to the excessive chalk.  First three bolts are all .12 moves.  Start on a ledge; you can go either straight up to the first bolt, which is more difficult, or move right off the deck up to a ledge of good holds and travers to the first bolt.  After the fourth bolt, the pressure eases up considerably (maybe .7 or .8), with longer distances between bolts.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor.

content.description:
This route is a pretty fun route, but its otherwise cool nature is somewhat diminished by the flexing flakes that you use for holds, sometimes including the ones you are clipping from. The small and sustained nature of this climb gives it its grade, not the individual moves, which are probably only moderate 5.10. 

  Approach Panty Wall and walk to the far left, up a broad sloping gully to a very steep wall. At the left end of this wall is a flat face with a flake near the bottom. The crux, if I recall is about 1/2-way up the route. 

  Crimp and layback for 60 feet or so, passing 6 bolts to fixed rap anchors.
content.protection: 6 bolts, chains

content.description: This top-rope route climbs the face directly to the right of Thong.
content.protection: Use the same anchor as for Thong.

content.description:
This is the right-most 'route' of the right-most buttress of Panty Wall. 

  Approach Panty Wall via the normal trail. Start up and right on the ramp at the wall's base, trying hard not to step on or be bumped off by one of the 3 dozen climbers standing on it on any given day... 

  Pass the standard up/down scramble, a 4th class gully splitting the wall, then pass a few small crack systems to reach a short curved crack and flake at the wall's right end. This is moderate in difficulty and memory dictates that it is a mere 5m high. Climb up and into the crack (crux), then to the top (5.5?). 

  Walk off right or to the left and scramble down the little gully.
content.protection: A light standard rack, by some reports (I did not protect). Were it not for the possibility for quite a tumble from the ledge below this route, it would probably be considered a boulder problem by most people.t

content.description:
Those who have never climbed on desert varnish will find this climb a splendid introduction.  The "glued on " nature of varnished holds over sandstone provides a unique climbing experience, of which the right hand flake near the first bolt is a fine example.  Remember, pull down and not out and don't climb when the rock is wet.  One would hate to contribute to the destruction of such an amazing climbing area. 

  Below the main wall, a flat ledge narrows and angles upwards the farther right you go.  It eventually opens up again below a lower angled portion of the face which allows 4th class access to set up tope ropes above.  Silk Panties starts midway up the narrow up-angling portion of the ledge and passes 5 bolts to a 3 bolt anchor.  The 5.7 rating may be a bit generous.
content.protection: 6 draws

content.description: The middle of the three 5.8s on the wall. Brief Encounter is to the left and Boxer Rebellion is to the right. VERY well protected!
content.protection: Many bolts to 2-bolt anchor.

content.description: This single pitch trad line on the Panty Wall is to the left of the popular sport routes on the main face. The climb begins on the left side of the face, near where the pine tree used to be.  It heads straight up the face to a small ceiling produced by the transition to the black varnished plates. Climb the left margin of an orange section to a thin right leaning crack to a two-bolt anchor on top.
content.protection: Standard rack

content.description: Panty Prow is a really fun arete climb on a formation just left of the main Panty Wall.  It climbs the right side of the wall past 5 bolts.
content.protection: Quickdraws. Fixed anchor at the top.

content.description: Great climb just left of Panty Prow.  Start on a block and use handholds to 1st bolt.  Past this it's all smearing feet with basically no hands.  Not too steep, very sustained difficulty.
content.protection: Nice bolts replaced early 2006,  rap anchor.
content.location: Head up to Panty Wall and then head up a steep gully slightly to the left.

content.description: Left-most route, start on arete, then up face.
content.protection: 4 bolts

content.description: Just right of Panty Raid
content.protection: Somewhat sparce

content.description: Nice thin crack into a bit of a dihedral, finishes up on the face/slab. 1 bolt at start, 1 bolt at end, and bolted anchors.
content.protection: 2 quickdraws, nuts, some small cams maybe (#.2 X4, #.5 I think).
content.location: This was the second to left-most route on the wall as of 2019.

content.description: Fun Crimpy route about as hard as Corner Office.
content.protection: 5 bolts to anchors
content.location:
Straight up the middle of the face between Office Maxx and Corner Office. Shares anchors with Corner Office.

 50 yards to the left of the upper-left tier of the Panty Wall.  Go left and down a short slab from the Panty Mime face.

content.description: A fine first lead and/or warm up climb on the Panty Wall, on the second bolt line from the right.
content.protection: 6 bolts, and a two bolt anchor on top. The anchors on this route are a bit far back, and a cordalette is handy for extending them down enough to prevent major rope drag.

content.description: This route climbs up from a small arching crack through varnished but crumbly rock to the same anchors as for Thong and Tighty Whities.  As of February 2007, this is the rightmost route on the Panty Wall.
content.protection: Use the same anchor as for Thong and Tighty Whities.

content.description: Fun climbing on interesting features, but may be considered fragile and runout, with tricky gear placements, and rated X (though opinions vary on this.) Makes a great toprope route. Start at the corner on a low ledge and climb the right-leaning flake ( a short, skinny staircase,) then move up through the crux as you get onto the beautiful varnish. Continue up the steep wall which goes slightly past vertical in spots, until reaching a small unvarnished notch. Then climb up onto the ledge to reach the anchor.
content.protection: Bring nuts and small gear. The  bolted anchor is located on the wall above and behind the ledge.
content.location: The furthest left route on the wall with the bolted moderates. Starts at the corner to the left of the small barrel cactus. The anchors can be reached from the top by rappeling from a two-bolt anchor above Silk Panties. To reach this anchor, walk past the tower on which Cover My Buttress and Thong are located, then scramble left up ramps until reaching a ledge above and to the left of Cover My Buttress. Rap from the anchors to the ledge below. There is another pair of bolts on the wall backing this ledge to clip into while managing the rope. This ledge goes across the top of the Panty Wall to the far corner where the anchors for Edible Panties are located.

content.description: straight up the seam on small, crispy holds to the ledge above. you can walk up to the ledge to set up a toprope, which is probably the best way to climb this thing.
content.protection: small nuts which can be placed as mostly psychological pro. bolted anchor on ledge.
content.location: Walk all the way to the right of the Panty Wall proper, past Butt Floss et al. Around the corner and up a bit is a short, friable looking seam.

content.description: nice easy warm up route for beginners. easy to protect or walk up to far right to set TR.  This can be in the shade
content.protection: small cams and anchor at top for a TR
content.location: far right of panty wall, the only trad route at the top of the ramp

content.description: Start on the slab face and climb up into the obvious corner.  Follow corner up and to the right.
content.protection: 6 Bolts
content.location: 50 yards to the left of the upper-left tier of the Panty Wall.  Go left and down a short slab from the Panty Mime face.

content.description:
Find the route Butt Floss (TR) as listed on this site- just to the left is a TR line that is independent and of independent character. If you were going to bother with a TR for the 7m of climbing on Butt Floss, you may as well double your mileage by climbing to the left of it as well. This crackless face is harder and more sustained. Maybe 11- or 10+. 

  Walk off right and down a ramp to the base again, or walk to the left and scramble down the little gully.
content.protection: This route is listed as a TR and seems to be done most commonly that way.  It is a little taller than the nearby 'Thong' (which I refer to as a boulder problem) and the crux is mid-route. Perhaps a TR this is for that reason.

content.description: Fantastic route for the grade!  I wouldn't say there is truly a crux on this climb but it would be constant 5.8 and fun.  Sport route up a steepening wall with good holds.  Excellent route!
content.protection: Total sport route with 6 bolts and chain anchors at the top just over the lip on the varnished wall.  Safe and well protected, go for it!
content.location: This route is the first sport route right of the large obvious black varnish section on the Panty wall and just barely right on the pine tree.  You can't miss it, just follow the bolts!

content.description: Another excellent sport route at the Panty Wall.  Pull a really fun move down low, then constant 5.8 climbing all the way to the anchors.  Offers good fun moves through a steepening wall that is really amazing for the grade.
content.protection: Sport route with 7 bolts to chain anchors just over the varnished edge at top of wall. Anchors now have stainless steel quicklinks and rap rings. Hopefully people don't start toproping off them.
content.location: This is the third sport route to the right from the pine tree and is obvious with a short vertical wall section as your first move right off the ledge

content.description: Another moderate sport route to help spread the crowds out. Red Rock moderates are getting loved to death. 7 bolts. Steep start and cruxy around the 4th bolt.
content.protection: 7 bolts. Hooks anchor. All bolts painted black.
content.location: Left of The Last Panty and right of Boxer Rebellion.

content.description:
This is the right-most 'route' of the right-most buttress of Panty Wall. 

  Approach Panty Wall via the normal trail. Start up and right on the ramp at the wall's base, trying hard not to step on or be bumped off by one of the 3 dozen climbers standing on it on any given day... 

  Pass the standard up/down scramble, a 4th class gully splitting the wall, then pass a short 5.8 crack systems to reach right-facing flake near the ground. Climb up from this flake to a short 5.10a crack (one move wonder) and then up to the top of the wall. Memory dictates that it is a mere 7m high.  

  Walk off right and down a ramp to the base again, or walk to the left and scramble down the little gully.
content.protection: This route is listed as a TR and seems to be done most commonly that way.  It is a little taller than the nearby 'Thong' (which I refer to as a boulder problem) and the crux is mid-route. Perhaps a TR this is for that reason.

content.description: Popular area with several moderates.
